content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Score A has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures or time signatures. The score has only one measure. The rhythm for the score is: quarter, eighth, eighth, and quarter. The pitches in score A are: G3, E3, C3, and G2.

Score B has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures or time signatures. The rhythm for the score is: quarter, eighth, eighth, and quarter. score has only one measure. The pitches in score B are: G3, E flat 3, C3, and G2.

Score C has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures or time signatures. The score has only one measure. The rhythm for the score is: quarter, eighth, eighth, and quarter. The pitches in score C are: G3, D3, B2, and G2.

Score D has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures or time signatures. The score has only one measure. The rhythm for the score is: quarter, eighth, eighth, and quarter.  The pitches in score D are: G3, D3, B flat 2, and G2.

content.answer: Score B has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures or time signatures. The rhythm for the score is: quarter, eighth, eighth, and quarter. score has only one measure. The pitches in score B are: G3, E flat 3, C3, and G2.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
